result.execSummary:
Michael A. Reed was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael A. Reed was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Reed

records.addlTxt: Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) without counsel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. waived his right to counsel.  Def. advised of his rights and voluntarily waived extradition to Lake Co., Illinois.

213pm
  Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Referred to Br 8 for further disposition on 4/8/15 @ 900am for extradition waiver hrg.  $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
